intro: Thesium foliosum, commonly known as the leafy thesium, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Thesium foliosum is adapted to withstand drought and is considered a hardy, low-maintenance plant.
